text: The oldest, shortest and perhaps smartest of the directorate. Arkat Fooger is a shrewd businessman and warrior a like.
Foogershuis is a bank, vault and estate all in one. It is the beating heart of the Fooger operation and worth a fortune.
Usurer's Row is the nickname for the area in Marienburg with a dense dwarven population. All either loyal or related to Arkat Fooger.
Not just a businessman, Arkat Fooger and his family specialize in the iron trade. They know their way around a mine as they know their way around a bank.
House Fooger is as old as they are rich. Recent dealing however did put a massive dent in their aspirations, and Arkat has to dig deep in order to recover lost riches.
The Smiths of Guilderveld, mostly of dwarven heritage could rival any within the Empire.
Despite being priced out by Jaan van de Kuypers, Fooger is still a very clever businessman who knows which investments will pay off and which will surely fail.
One of the first families part of the directorate, Clan Fooger is as reputed as they are renown within the Empire.
One does not simply accumulate wealth by luck, it requires skill and a keen sense to find that which holds value.
Rashasawa has long lived with the mysterious people of Nippon, learning their ways and harnassing their skills.
Unyielding determination shields allies from harm in the face of adversity.
This extremely light weaponry in combination with dwarfish strength makes for a deadly mixture of steel flurry.
Rashasawa maps out the safest and most lucrative trade routes, maximizing profits for the caravan.
Ogg has mastered the ways of gunpowder, studying under only the very best in Nuln's Academy.
Commands a formidable defensive formation around the caravan, deterring would-be attackers and bandits.
He strikes shrewd deals with local traders and merchants, securing advantageous trade agreements for the caravan.
Rallies allies in the face of overwhelming odds, instilling unwavering courage in the face of danger.
Palldee delivers a crushing blow with the hammer, shattering enemy defenses and breaking their ranks.
Draws upon years of combat experience to outmaneuver and outsmart foes.
Moves with unparalleled agility, evading enemy strikes and navigating obstacles with ease.
Shares the brew of the dwarven gods, rejuvenating allies' spirits and replenishing their strength for the journey ahead.
Inspires confidence and discipline in the caravan, maintaining order and efficiency during long journeys.
Serving as prime executioner among Bretonnian Nobility many throughout the stretched fields have come to fear Palldee's Hammer.
Identifies valuable resources and artifacts along the caravan's route, enriching the caravan's coffers with rare finds.
Trained by Jubal Falk, Ogg learned the fine art of a steady aim.
Watches over allies with unwavering vigilance, intercepting threats before they reach the caravan.
It is unsure how long Rashasawa spent on the mysterious Isle of Nippon, fact is he learned much about the art of swordplay there.
